learning_outcomes.description: Apply theoretical concepts to construct analytical statistical techniques.
Describe the statistical techniques needed to solve particular problem types.
Conduct statistical analysis of data so as to draw statistical conclusions.
Communicate statistical findings for practical and professional use.

assessments.weighting: <dd>25% (Best 7 out of 10 tutorials, from only Tutorial 3 through to Tutorial 12) </dd>
assessments.due_date:
During a student's signed on tutorial 3/03/2025 - 30/05/2025

At the end of each tutorial.
assessments.task_description:
Student participation is assessed by tutors who mark students’ individual handwritten solutions to tutor nominated tutorial questions from Week 2 to Week 13. Students write solutions on a blank sheet of paper (without using prewritten answers) that tutors mark after the tutorial. Students are required to attend the same tutorial each week.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students must give their hand written tutorial solutions to the tutor at the end of the tutorial to receive a mark. Non submission of any hand written work will result in 0 marks awarded for that in-tutorial assessment activity. Submission of work at a tutorial where a student is NOT signed on may be marked by the tutor. However, students are strongly encouraged to only attend the tutorial they signed on to (to receive their written work back the following week). Note that students can attend a different tutorial during the semester when their tutorial occurs on a public holiday, as outlined in this course profile under Learning Activities.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
The Islands is an online tool that provides a population of virtual humans for students to use as subjects in studies. The research project will require students to use The Islands to select random samples from Islander inhabitants, identify appropriate variables, conduct experiments on the inhabitants and collect relevant data. Students will then need to analyse their data using Excel and submit a 1000-word individual written research report through Turnitin. Full details can be found on Blackboard.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The research written report must be submitted using the Turnitin Link on Blackboard under Assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The Final Exam will assess material relating to Lectures 5 to 12 inclusively.

There will be no multiple choice questions. Problem type questions will need to be solved, where all working will be required to be shown, along with possible written explanations of solutions or linking solutions to theoretical ideas.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
